Jojo_Mason:
{{short description|Canadian country music singer-songwriter (born 1990)}} {{Use mdy dates|date=September 2019}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Jojo Mason | image = Jojo Mason.jpg | caption = | image_size = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1990|02|26|mf=yes}} | birth_name = | birth_place = [[Regina, Saskatchewan]], Canada{{cite web|title=Jojo Mason|url=http://www.manicdown.com/jojo-mason.html|website=Manicdown Productions|accessdate=February 19, 2016|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150302044247/http://www.manicdown.com/jojo-mason.html|archivedate=March 2, 2015}} | origin = | instrument = Guitar, piano | genre = {{hlist|[[Country music|Country]]|[[country pop]]}} | occupation = Singer-songwriter | years_active = 2015–present | label = Manicdown, [[604 Records|604]] | associated_acts = | website = }} '''Jojo Mason''' (born February 26, 1990) is a Canadian [[country music]] singer-songwriter. Mason moved to [[Victoria, British Columbia]] in 2004 to play [[ice hockey|hockey]] at the junior (Saanich Jr Braves, VIJHL) ranks but suffered a [[spinal disc herniation|herniated disk]]. Later, he met songwriter/producer Dan Swinimer and worked on developing his vocals. He signed to Manicdown Productions in 2014 and released his debut single, "It's All Good", in early 2015.{{cite web|title=About Manicdown Productions|url=http://www.manicdown.com/|website=Manicdown Productions|accessdate=February 19, 2016}} It reached the top 10 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Canada Country]] chart. Mason's second single, "Good Kinda Love", was released in November 2015.{{cite news|last1=Fielder|first1=Courtney|title=JoJo Mason Debut's "Good Kinda Love"|url=http://www.discovermoosejaw.com/country-100/44231-jojo-mason-debut-s-good-kinda-love|accessdate=February 19, 2016|work=[[CILG-FM|Country 100]]|date=November 4, 2015|archive-date=March 2, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160302024145/http://www.discovermoosejaw.com/country-100/44231-jojo-mason-debut-s-good-kinda-love|url-status=dead}} He signed to [[604 Records]] for the release of his third single, "Red Dress", in May 2016.{{citation needed|date=August 2023}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- !
